Deficiency Narrative: One of the children's medication log was missing the time, name, and signature of the staff who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative:
1.Process for Ensuring Complete and Accurate MARs:
Standardized MAR Template: Pinecrest uses a standardized Medication Administration Record (MAR) that includes mandatory fields: medication name, dosage, time of administration, staff initials, staff signature, and running pill count. The form cannot be submitted if fields are left blank.
Staff Training & Competency Testing: All staff responsible for administering medication undergo hands-on MAR training and a competency exam requiring 100% accuracy in recording dosages, signatures, counts, and times. They must demonstrate proper completion of both MAR and Medication Error Reports during testing.
Medication Error Reporting: The Medication Error Log and Reporting Protocol is in place. Every missed, late, or undocumented dose must be reported on the MER form, signed by the staff, and reviewed by the Health Liaison. Reports are filed in the childs record and logged electronically for tracking.
Assurance of Prescribed Administration: Only trained staff are permitted to administer medications. Staff designated to administer medication may not be placed in ratio until training and competency testing are documented. Additionally, medication sheets are cross-checked daily to ensure all medications are dispensed exactly as prescribed.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the staff's TIC training was taken on 2/1/2024 then again on 7/23/2025. The training was taken 5 months late.
Correction Narrative: 2.	Staff cannot count toward ratio until they complete all mandatory training. This ensures only fully compliant staff are supervising children, protecting youth safety and ensuring regulatory adherence.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to show competency and prudent judgment when video recording a child exhibiting escalated behaviors and engaging in property destruction.  The footage was captured on the caregivers cell phone and shared with another employee.  While recording the event, the caregiver failed to preserve the childs privacy, was unable to intervene for the safety of the children in care, and failed to maintain the facility.
Correction Narrative: Staff and children were interviewed during the inspection with no concerns noted.

Deficiency Narrative: A designated spot to shelter in place was not indicated on the evacuation diagram for the operation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included an updated evacuation diagram for the operation to include a designated shelter in place location.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, one battery operated camera was observed mounted on the wall in the children's restroom (lobby). Staff was not able to provide inspector with written approval from CVS caseworker or any approved waiver to use camera in children restroom area.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, one battery operated camera was observed mounted on the wall in the children's restroom (lobby). Staff was not able to provide inspector with written approval from CVS caseworker or any approved waiver to use camera in children restroom area.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, evidence of water leak was observed in the kitchen and resident room ceiling.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, evidence of water leak was observed in the kitchen and resident room ceiling.

Deficiency Narrative: Five employees of the operation completed a different EBI curriculum than what's utilized at the operation evidenced by training certificates reviewed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator that included a corrective action plan indicating the employees have all taken the CPI EBI training to be compatible with other employees. The email also included verification of the completed trainings. On August 23, 2024, an email was received from the operation's administrator which included a safety plan for the employees who were missing the same EBI training until they were able to complete the training.

Deficiency Narrative: One of three employee files reviewed did not contain documentation of the reference checks completed on the employee.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the administrator with a copy of the verification of the missing reference checks for an employee.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was reviewed and the Operation is deemed to be not in compliance hereof.
Correction Narrative: The operation e-mailed a statement saying the staff member in question is currently not employed at the operation pending an Administrative Review for their RTB finding.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff file reviewed did not have a current normalcy training.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent documentation of the staff members completed normalcy training.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff file reviewed did not have a current CPR/First aid training.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent documentation of the staff members completed CPR/First Aid training.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of this investigation, it was determined that the safety and well-being of the child was compromised in contravention to the provisions of the child's Safety Plan.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent the following statement in regards to the citation: All Pinecrest direct care staff will continue to supervise children in care according to Minimum Standards and according to the Safety Plan of children in care. The owner/Administrator also stated in a phone conversation that he did not have a Safety Plan for the child in question.

Deficiency Narrative: The menu was observed to be outdated in addition there were no snacks or food sustitutions on the menu.
Correction Narrative: The operations menu was updated to meet minimum standards. A copy of the updated menu was e-mailed.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the dressers in a child's bedroom was observed to be broken, it was missing a knob and had a protruding nail in addition the first drawer was broken and was missing the part of the drawer that is needed to hold the child's clothing in it.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent pictures of the dresser in question. It had been repaired to meet minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of this investigation, it was determined that staff utilizes restraints for non emergency situations such as kids cursing staff or not listening to staff.
Correction Narrative: Five out of five children interviewed on 12/06/2023 stated they have not been restrained since being placed at the operation nor have they witnessed a restraint. The operation stated every staff member was retrained in EBI and documentation was e-mailed along with the statement for proof.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregivers involved in the EBI did not conduct a post discussion with the child after the EBI.
Correction Narrative:
In response to the deficiencies found in investigation # 3029843, Pinecrest has retrained staff on Emergency Behavior Intervention according to Minimum Standards  General Residential Operations. Please accept the attachments as proof of completed training.
On 12/06/2023, five residents were interviewed and stated they have never been restrained since being placed at the operation and have not witnessed a restraint since being placed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was restrained longer than 30 minutes.
Correction Narrative:
In response to the deficiencies found in investigation # 3029843, Pinecrest has retrained staff on Emergency Behavior Intervention according to Minimum Standards  General Residential Operations. Please accept the attachments as proof of completed training.
On 12/06/2023, five residents were interviewed and stated they have never been restrained since being placed at the operation and have not witnessed a restraint since being placed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregivers did not explain to the child what they needed to do to be released from the EBI.
Correction Narrative:
In response to the deficiencies found in investigation # 3029843, Pinecrest has retrained staff on Emergency Behavior Intervention according to Minimum Standards  General Residential Operations. Please accept the attachments as proof of completed training.
On 12/06/2023, five residents were interviewed and stated they have never been restrained since being placed at the operation and have not witnessed a restraint since being placed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection cups with children names were in the kitchen after being used and not disposed.
During an after hours visit at the operation, the medicine cabinet was observed to be unlocked.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a Corrective Action Plan which stated the following: The licensed childcare administrator and/or designee will train all administrative and direct care staff on the minimum standards and Pinecrest's Operation Manual regarding medication storage to prevent children from gaining access to and ingesting medication by themselves. An in person follow-up inspection was conducted on 12/12/2022. A picture was taken of the operations new medication storage cabinet and uploaded to the digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Supervision needs for the group of children required a closer supervision for more than 3 of the children. Specifically one child had a service plan which required a 1:5 ratio while sleeping. There were two other children whose ratio should have been elevated based on their history.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a Corrective Action Plan which stated the following: The licensed childcare administrator and/or designee will train all administration and direct care staff on the ideology and implementation of Child/Caregiver ratio outlined in both in Minimum Standards and Pinecrest's Operations Manual. Pinecrest will employ an adequate number of caregivers to meet their responsibilities regarding supervision of children in care. An in person follow-up was conducted on 12/12/2022. Children were interviewed in regards to child/caregiver ratio and supervision. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to inform the administration that his co-worker left the operation during the shift and that he was working alone. Another caregiver failed to inform the administration that he was leaving his shift early.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a Corrective Action Plan which stated the following: The licensed childcare administrator and/or designee will train all administrative and direct care staff on the policy and procedures for absenteeism and tardiness. The licensed childcare administrator and/or designee will retrain staff on the importance of demonstrating competency, prudent judgement, self-control, in the presence of children and when performing assigned tasks.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation was not in compliance with a child's supervision requirements.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a Corrective Action Plan which stated the following: The licensed childcare administrator and/or designee will train all administrative and direct care staff on the minimum standards and Pinecrest's Operation Manual regarding the caregiver's responsibility of providing the level of supervision necessary to ensure a child's safety and well-being. An in person follow-up was conducted on 12/12/2022. Children were interviewed in regards to child/caregiver ratio and supervision. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of out 8 medication records was not updated with the amount administered within 2 hours.
Correction Narrative: This standard has been reviewed and is compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through it was observed that the South hallway exit door did not have a verified inspection tag for the fire extinguisher hanging (photos taken).
Correction Narrative: A new fire extinguisher was purchased and a picture of both the fire extinguisher and receipt were e-mailed. The last fire inspection was conducted on 06/28/2021.

Deficiency Narrative: One discharged child's file did not contain name, address, telephone number, and relationship of person to whom the child was discharged to.
Correction Narrative: An updated discharge form was e-mailed, which contains all required information.

Deficiency Narrative: One of four child files reviewed did not contain a TB test.
Correction Narrative: A copy of the child's TB test results were e-mailed.

Deficiency Narrative: One discharged child's file did not include the circumstances for the discharge.
Correction Narrative: An updated discharge form was e-mailed, which contains all required information.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff file reviewed did not contain a copy of a cleared tuberculosis screening.
Correction Narrative: The administrator e-mailed the staff members negative TB test.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff files reviewed did not contain a statement signed and dated by the employee confirming they have read a copy of the operational policies.
Correction Narrative: The administrator e-mailed a signed and dated document which states the staff members have read the facilities operational policies.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff file reviewed did not contain a high school diploma.
Correction Narrative: The administrator e-mailed a copy of the staff members high school diploma

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff files reviewed did not contain a signed and dated statement by the employee that he/she must immediately report suspected abuse, neglect or exploitation.
Correction Narrative: The administrator e-mailed a copy of a document signed and dated by the employees which states they will report suspected abuse/neglect or exploitation.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff files reviewed did not contain a current job description.
Correction Narrative: I was e-mailed a copy of two staff members job descriptions that will be placed in their files.
